page.title: 10VILLAGE LIFE IN THE 1900'S.
page.content: We visited an elderly gentleman who came to Ceres in l909 when he was only 2 years old.In l912 he started Ceres Primary then he went to Bell Baxter which at that time was feepaying. He left school when he was 16. In l939 he and a friend took over Charles Smith & Son which was an Ironmonger, Newsagent & Grocer's business.He was the only newsagent in the village,and today there is still only one newsagent but in those days he used to have about 20 dozen 'Couriers' delivered each morning. He also did a thriving business in blended whisky which he sent to the North of England.People used to come from towns and villages all around to shop in Ceres and some used to push their messages home in a wheelbarrow.
